intro: Clarkia concinna, commonly known as the slender clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Clarkia concinna is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy care requirements.
